rev.desc.rev.desc: remove panel iterate
QCCR1E60089-IR search returns incorrect QBE format
panel: set.contents.1.0
add "cleanup($L.qbe.name)"
Panel display.rec
Changed nullsub expression from:
$L.qbe.name=nullsub($L.ir.qbeformat, $L.qbe.name)
to:
$L.qbe.name=nullsub($L.qbe.name, $L.ir.qbeformat)
Removed call to obsolete function current.window() and current.scroll()
panel confirm
Added false to the Cancel flag parameter.
CP scr34429
panel: prompt.contents
added expression: $L.has.records=nullsub($L.has.records, false)

The problem was that $L.has.records does not always have a value. Therefore, I added a nullsub expression to this panel and nullsubed it to 'false'. This resolves the issue on the prompt.contents.gui panel where if $L.has.records=NULL then the back button does not show up.
There was still a problem if the $L.ir.type was not defined.
Changed to:
if ($L.ir.type=8) then if (index("irfield=", 1 in $L.ir.fieldname in $L.ir.file)>0) then ($L.ir.query=str($L.field)+"#\""+str(1 in $L.ir.fieldname in $L.ir.file)+"\"")
and added:
if null($L.ir.type) then if (index("irfield=", $L.ir.fieldname in $L.ir.file)>0) then ($L.ir.query=str($L.field)+"#\""+str($L.ir.fieldname in $L.ir.file)+"\"")
SCR 34657 Task 31562
Query issued in sc.knowledge application is not constructed correctly when specifying field to query against.

Problem is in application sc.knowledge on panel set.ir.field.1 , The incorrect query is constructed and issued when specifying the field that the query is to be issued against. Add to the panel as the last line the following code:
if (index("irfield=", 1 in $L.ir.fieldname in $L.ir.file)>0) then ($L.ir.query=str($L.field)+"#\""+str(1 in $L.ir.fieldname in $L.ir.file)+"\"")
panel start
added ;if null($L.ir.cf.filename) then ($L.no.post=true;$L.ir.cf.filename=nullsub($L.ir.cf.filename, "probsummary"))
Added new panel decide.post.source.fields as exit for copy.fields
When entering through menu, the fields used to create the contents query are now taken from the datadict record of the file being queried.
recompile only, no changes.
panel: exit.normal
changed the expression: irspread(2)
to irspread(0)
devtx BUG13519
added the following to the prompt.contents panel:
if (filename($L.ir.tc)~=filename($L.ir.file)) then ($L.has.records=false)

On check.select, appended the follwoing to the exit conditions: or gui() and sysinfo.get("reclist") so that if record list is turned on, reselect the IR record even if the last action is identical to the current one. Prior to the fix, switching between record list settings was causing blank records to be displayed.
Added $L.str.contents to the array of display variables on display.record.
Added $L.str.contents to the array of display variables on select.form.1.
Changed panels:

* create.contents.query - uses $L.ir.link instead of $L.init.link to set up the contents query; when switching files, $L.ir.link gets reselected but $L.init.link will retain the value of the old link if $L.ir.link does not exist.
* set.ir.field.1 - changed $L.ir.type~=8 to null($L.ir.type); strraw $L.ir.contents if the query field is scalar
Added parameter so that the initial action could be passed in ("common.prob", "ir.query", etc.)
Fixed list exit.
Fixed to use record list option correctly. Also fixed the "view query" option to show correct query terms.
Modified so that the query based on the categorization will use (field=field in $L.ir.file or field=NULL) instead of just matching on field name.
For BetaTest2002 Ticket IM00114:

Made changes so that when doing IR learning (formerly known as Adaptive Learning), the IR text used for learning should be the original text used to start the knowledge search, NOT what the user last entered.
This required the following changes to be done to this application:
. In panel start, added code to save the original contents into variable $L.ir.contents.orig.
. In panel start.learning, this variable ($L.ir.contents.orig) instead of $L.ir.contents is passed to the start.learning application.
No changes. Removed extraneous panels.
For CenterPoint Task 18405 for Request 18909.
Fixed bug wherein if a field in an IR key is a field that is NOT of type Array of Character, the query being built is a true query. The panel where this bug was that was fixed is set.ir.field.1.
Removed nullsub of the display.format in the datadict on panel setup.file.
recompiled after fixing database errors.
Modified to support diagnostic aids.

added panel pre.check.iterate that will set up the return resolution data to be posted back to the source record. Was only working if learning was on, but should work for all reacords where The Use learning option has been selected. It is a new process panel with the follow code:
$RETURN=$L.return.field in $L.ir.file
Updated to use source record to build source tag which is passed to the start learning application. ( builds adlrelation)
Changed for learing will now call start.learning to build the adlrelation record when the use resolution option is chosen.
Case insensitivity problem fixes.
Replaced qbe panel with genquery.
Added call to format.cdisp on sc.knowledge.prompt.
Added call to format.cdisp on $L.ir.fc.
On panel qbe.0, took out $L.ir.format=NULL
Add ability to restrict ir query to a given field in the ir key.
Converted to use display and split screen.
Changed to use sorting code in display.
Added sorting (does it make sense here?)
scmsg
Changed the default IR Spreading to "Shallow" (0) instead of "Deep" (2).
Adjusted to handle scalar input fields.
Moved the "Advanced" option into the options menu and renamed it "View Query".
Added to variable to control the "Copy" and "Use Resolution" options.
Get the contents and filename on the same rio panel in text mode.
setup.file: Do not nullsub the qbe format ($L.ir.qbeformat). If there is not qbe format entry in the datadict record let the system use the default qbe format.
nullsub the $L.knowledge.disp values with the name of the datadict to prevent null entries in the array.
Setup $pmc.details and $pmc.actions prior to displaying probsummary records.
Default to Global Knowledge ("core") only when entering for the first time - otherwise keep the current setting. Also check that "core" exist before switching to it!
Instead of doing the evaluation during the select, evaluate condition when building the list variables.
Now evaluates the condition field when querying for datadict records.
Now supports complete matching
Patched to set IR Spreading to Shallow when the application terminates.
Patched to enable Shallow & Deep IR Spreading
patched to allow it to work properly with local
variables enabled

Patched to allow for the SE's to spawn word or AVI documents from knowledge file as per their request: NOTE: Will only actually WORK on windows boxes with word and/or an AVI viewer registered. Cheesy, but they wanted it, so here they go.
